course_title: Fresh Sem:Environmentl Studies: Clouds in a Glass of Beer
class_notes: From puffy white things in the sky to roaring beasts carrying havoc and destruction, clouds have been puzzling the humankind for centuries. Covering 2/3 of the Earth¿s surface and controlling the energy balance of the planet, clouds are the major source of uncertainty in climate predictions. In this class, through lectures, discussions and simple experiments, students will learn about the physical mechanisms governing cloud formation, existence and dissipation. We will also explore the role of clouds in the Earth¿s climate system, as well as the human attempts to control the weather and climate by cloud modification.
course_description: The topics for freshman seminars are variable and change every semester. Past offerings include Climate Change, Global Earth Systems, Interpreting Behavior That You Can't See, Ecological Economics, Plants, People and Places and Ecological Restoration.
schedule_location: MW 11:30am-12:45pm in Math & Science Center - W502
